intro: Lellingeria stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's lellingeria, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
